intro: Senecio macrotis, commonly known as the giant blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Senecio macrotis typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and resilience.
